basic.floral_language:
Brugmansia arborea 
Floriography: wise, graceful, fortunate
Brugmansia arborea has funnel-shaped flowers, like morning glory.
Stout upright stems and broadly ovate leaves with wavy and toothed edges, huge flowers, funnel-shaped or trumpet-shaped in rich colors such as blue, purple, white, pink, etc. Brugmansia arborea has medical values, but may be fatally toxic.
Brugmansia arborea likes adequate sunlight. Flowering from May to September for 2-3 weeks.
basic.blooming: Flowering period May-September, viewing period 2-3 weeks

maintenance.soil: Peat or soil with specific nutrients
maintenance.sunlight: Likes sunshine, put in sunny places, avoid strong sunlight in summer at noon
maintenance.watering: Water thoroughly when soil is dry, reduce watering in winter
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions, apply 1-2 times monthly, except flowering stages
maintenance.pruning: Remove old, diseased and dead leaves timely
